**Great effort!** 🌟 You’ve already identified the key idea—*keep the same “feel” (the ratio) when you change the amounts*. That’s exactly what we need to do with proportions. Let’s tidy up the details together so the numbers line up.

## 1️⃣ What the ratio really means  

The original recipe says  

\[
\frac{\text{flour}}{\text{sugar}}=\frac{2}{3}\qquad\text{or}\qquad
\frac{\text{sugar}}{\text{flour}}=\frac{3}{2}.
\]

So for **every 2 cups of flour you need 3 cups of sugar**.  
If you double the flour (2 → 4), you must also double the sugar (3 → 6).  
If you triple the flour (2 → 6), you triple the sugar (3 → 9).  
The **same factor** must be applied to *both* parts of the ratio.
